image:image.image:title: Home - Send us your pictures of New Hope! We'd like to add interest to our website and social media posts by including your pictures of New Hope. Residents enjoy photos of landmarks or bygone times they recognize. Send an email with your picture(s) to mcc.admin@newhopetx.gov Old pictures, new pictures, curious pictures.....we want them all! And tell us whatever you know about the photo. Thanks for your time and sharing!
Home
image:image.image:caption: New Hope Residents - Please consider joining a New Hope committee! These committees are important to the growth and well being of our town. Do you have an interest in planning and zoning for our town? Consider our Planning & Zoning Commission. Do you have an interest in getting information out to neighbors? Consider our Media & Communications Committee. Do you have an interest in planning events for our town? Consider our Event Planning & Coordination Committee. Do you have other interests that would benefit New Hope? Reach out to our Town Hall at 972-548-2489 or Secretary@NewHopeTx.gov with your contact information and areas of interest!

image:image.image:title: Archives - TEXAS BROADBAND LISTENING TOUR 2022
image:image.image:caption: “To guide the strategic vision of Texas’ new Broadband Development Office (BDO), Comptroller Glenn Hegar will tour 12 communities to get Texans’ insights about internet access and collect input to develop the state’s first broadband plan. These events are free, and Texans are encouraged to attend and share their thoughts about broadband services in their communities”. If you wish to participate in these forums, please sign-up for the Texas BDO newsletter - link. The tour date for the NCTCOG region is Tuesday, March 22nd at 11:00am. Registration for the event is not live yet, but please consider saving the date and time. We will send you an email update once the registration link is live. The Texas BDO is also seeking input on broadband/internet connectivity via an online survey form – link. This survey provides an opportunity for residents, business owners, the whole community to provide feedback on local broadband needs. We encourage you to share the link with your community, businesses, neighborhoods, school districts, and colleagues.

image:image.image:title: Archives - HAZARD MITIGATION ACTION PLAN (HazMAP) WebEx Meeting
image:image.image:caption: Below are additional details for the meeting, including a link to register. Everyone will need to register to receive the WebEX login information to attend. This is needed to provide FEMA and TDEM with an accounting of who attended the meeting. When you and other attendees register via the link below, you should automatically receive an email with the call-in information after a few minutes. If you do not, please email me at rgurney@co.collin.tx.us. We are asking that you post the information below on your City’s respective websites and share as you see fit. Meeting Information Date: Tuesday, November 2nd Time: 2:00PM – 3:30PM Format: Virtual via WebEx Registration Link: https://collincountytx.webex.com/collincountytx/j.php... Questions or issues: rgurney@co.collin.tx.us We have a tentative agenda. This may change. Once it is finalized I will send out a PDF of the agenda as well. Agenda · Welcome/Introductions · Overview (PowerPoint) · Open Discussion and Citizen Comments · Next Steps · Closing Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns. Randall Randall Gurney Assistant EM Specialist Collin County 972-548-5581 (d) 214-250-7112 (c) rgurney@co.collin.tx.us

image:image.image:title: Archives - TxDOT has extended the comment period for the US 380 EIS project from Coit Road to FM 1827 through Thursday, April 21, 2022.
image:image.image:caption: TxDOT encourages you to visit the public meeting website www.keepitmovingdallas.com/US380EISPublicMeeting to review study materials and to submit comments. You can also submit comments by email to Stephen.Endres@txdot.gov, or by mail to Mr. Stephen Endres, P.E., TxDOT Dallas District Office, 4777 East US Highway 80, Mesquite, Texas 75150-6643. All comments must be received or postmarked by Thursday, April 21, 2022 to be included in the official public record. If you have any general questions regarding the proposed project, please contact the TxDOT Project Manager, Mr. Stephen Endres, P.E., at (214) 320-4469 or Stephen.Endres@txdot.gov.

image:image.image:title: Archives - Announcement from Grayson Collin Electric Co-Op
image:image.image:caption: UPDATE: ERCOT says the Texas power grid “remains strong during record demand” Tuesday afternoon while also calling on Texans’ to continue to conserve power from 3 p.m. to 7 p.m. daily through Friday. Currently the Co-op has no plans to issue rolling outages. ERCOT has issued conservation warnings to encourage Texans to consume less energy. We cannot control the remainder of the state, but we are doing everything we can to keep your power on locally. We encourage members to conserve where they can. We will update if anything changes. Thank you!

image:image.image:title: Archives - UPDATE: The mailbox vandalism is continuing. A report has been made to Collin County Sheriff. ANY incidence where your mailbox and/or mail has been tampered with needs to be reported to the Sheriff. Call 972-547-5350, ask for Roy Carter in reference to Service Number (report number) 22026437. His email is Rcarter@co.Collin.Tx.us Please be diligent to report any occurrences. If you sustained theft of any sort, contact the USPS at https://www.uspis.gov/report to make a report. Also report the vandalism/theft to USPS as well.
image:image.image:caption: It's been reported that someone is illegally opening mailboxes in New Hope, rifling through the mail, stealing mail and discarding it onto the grounds and streets. THIS IS A FELONY. If you know who's doing this and/or have security camera evidence that may assist the authorities in identifying the thieves, please report this to the Postal Inspectors @ 877-876-2455.

image:image.image:title: Archives
image:image.image:caption: At the February 22, 2022 Town Council meeting, representatives from the North Texas Municipal Water District gave an update presentation about the Sister Grove Water Resource Recovery Facility being constructed next to New Hope (off FM2933). The presenters were: RJ Muraski, Assistant Deputy Director – CIP and Planning Morgan Dadgostar, Regional Wastewater System Manager Michael Brogdon, Manager Chuck Gilman, Program Manager Freese and Nichols Should you have any questions, your contact will be Morgan Dadgostar, P.E. Regional Wastewater System Manager mdadgostar@ntmwd.com Office: 469-626-4935 The presentation slides can be viewed here

image:image.image:title: Archives - SPRING STORM SEASON IS UPON US BE. PREPARED. with these links………
image:image.image:caption: Collin County Emergency Management. This link has a menu option to sign up for emergency notification alerts, including the ability to advise emergency services of any special needs in your household. Click on this link for storm and tornado safety reminders City of McKinney Severe Weather information website City of McKinney Outdoor Warning Siren System website New Hope is served by Grayson Collin Electric Co-Op. Here are options to report outages and get outage updates. Use your registered SmartHub account or download the MyGCEC app, for iOS or for Android, to get started. https://www.gcec.net/report-outage To report a new outage: Text OUT to 768482 To get outage updates: Text STATUS to 768482 Or log in to your MyGCEC Account
